docs.title: SeaWolf IX Documentation
docs.text:
Documentation for AquaPack Robotics' SeaWolf IX.

SeaWolf IX is designed to compete in the RoboSub competition each year. SeaWolf IX is AquaPack Robotic's 9th robot.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
1. As many IO pins as we can have
  2. Don't need a FP-unit
  3. Availablity and long-term support
  4. Low-power (neglible power-budget requirements)
  5. Performance not as necessary

docs.title: STM32
docs.text: The STM32 family of microcontrollers has been identified as a strong candidate for this application due to it being very well supported, its wide selections, and its low cost.

docs.title: STM32L051C6T6
docs.text:
• ARM Cortex M0+
  • 32KB Flash Memory
  • 32 MHz
  • Up to 51 GPIO pins
  • 88 micro Amp/MHz in run mode
  • 2 I2C Busses
  • 1 UART
  • Guaranteed support until 2033

docs.title: Other Similar MCUs
docs.text: Microcontroller Processor STM32C0 48MHz Cortex-M0+ STM32G0 64MHz Cortex-M0+ STM32F0 48MHz Cortex-M0 STM32F1 72MHz Cortex-M3 STM32L0 32MHz Cortex-M0+ STM32L4 80MHz Cortex-M4 STM32L4+ 120MHz Cortex-M4

docs.title: MCU Board Specifications
docs.text: Four Planes: 1. Top Plane (most components located here) 2. Ground Plane 3. Power VDD Plane 4. Bottom Plane
